author: slava77
body:
Updates to vertex sorting score assignment for somewhat special cases.
- For a general case of a particle with pt less than ptError, don't use it to make a jet (instead of passing 0,0,0,0 to fastjet).
- If all input particles have pt less than ptError, use the count of input particles times 0.01. These vertices will get a very low score if other well measured vertices exist (instead of zero score now). If all vertices are like that (most often the case for pp in B=0T), the number of tracks associated to the vertex becomes the score. This is somewhat more sensible than a rather random sum of pt^2 (track pt in B=0T is not well defined).

The fixes are a follow up to the bug reported in https://hypernews.cern.ch/HyperNews/CMS/get/recoDevelopment/1415.html
title: fix to PV sorting when all track momenta are not well measured (B=0T case mainly)
